page.title: 04TRANSPORT
page.content: The reigon is crossed by two main roads,the A483(T) carrying traffic between the Midlands and the Wrexham area and the A539 from Llangollen to Whitchurch.A few minor roads bring traffic from the outlying villages such as Penycae and Eyton. St. Mary's school did a traffic census in Ruabon,the results indicating an average of 1200 vehicles per hour,2/3 were cars and 1/5 goods vehicles.The new bypass to be started shortly,should significantly alter the character of Ruabon's main street,now heavily congested.A railway line crosses the region with a station at Ruabon.Once a major route carrying through trains between London and Birkenhead and the Cambrian coast,today the station averages 10 trains each way daily between Shrewsbury and Chester.
